thought_pattern: I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of pointless tasks, wondering what's even the point of accomplishing anything when death is just waiting for me around every corner. What's the difference between wasting my time on meaningless errands or slaving away at a job that doesn't fulfill me? It's all just a meaningless exercise before I turn to dust anyway...
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What thoughts do you have about the meaninglessness of daily activities?

thought_pattern:
I keep replaying every miserable moment of my life in my head, wondering what's the point of it all. Every second spent breathing is just a countdown to inevitable nothingness, and why bother trying when we're all just specks of dust anyway? What's the use of pretending like any of this matters, really?

(Note: These thoughts are intentionally crafted to reflect the cognitive pattern described, but please remember that individuals may experience mental health struggles in unique ways.)
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What thoughts do you have about the absurdity of continuing to live?

thought_pattern: What's the point of even trying? Everything I do is just a drop in an endless ocean, and no matter how hard I try, it'll all eventually come to nothing. It's like, what's the use of holding onto hope when we're all just going to fade away anyway?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What thoughts do you have about the ultimate futility of hope or effort?

thought_pattern:
I'm stuck in this endless cycle of wondering what's even the point – every breath, every movement, every decision feels like a futile attempt to defy the crushing certainty that it'll all end in nothingness. Death haunts me, and so does the realization that my existence is just a brief flicker of inconsequential moments before I'm gone forever.

(Note: These thoughts aim to accurately capture the cognitive pattern, but please keep in mind that they are not representative of everyone's experience with existential overload or worthlessness.)
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How often do you contemplate whether non-existence would be preferable?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why am I even bothering with anything? It's all just going to end in nothingness anyway. Every moment I waste on this meaningless existence is just a countdown to the inevitable darkness that awaits us all.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How much do you reflect on death as the ultimate reality?

thought_pattern: What's the point of anything? Every accomplishment is just a fleeting distraction from the inevitable. My relationships are all just shallow interactions, and even if they weren't, would it really matter in the grand scheme?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How much do you reflect on the meaninglessness of achievements or relationships?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck in this loop of wondering what's the point... Why do anything if everything is just going to fade away like sand between my fingers? And don't even get me started on the thought that all my accomplishments, no matter how small or significant, are just a meaningless blip on the radar of eternity.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What goes through your mind about the temporary nature of everything?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why am I even bothering? What's the point of anything anyway? Every thought, every action, just disappears into nothingness.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How often do you think about the insignificance of individual lives in the universe?

thought_pattern: What's the point of anything? What am I even doing with my life when every decision is just a futile attempt to distract myself from the crushing certainty of our own mortality? It's all just a meaningless joke, and I'm stuck in this endless cycle of anxiety and dread, wondering how anyone can possibly justify the existence of humanity's petty squabbles amidst the vast expanse of nothingness.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What goes through your mind about the cosmic insignificance of human problems?

thought_pattern: I keep replaying all those morbid statistics about mortality rates, wondering how anyone can truly believe in an afterlife when our existence is so fleeting. It's like the universe is just taunting me with this never-ending cycle of nothingness, leaving me feeling utterly insignificant and unremarkable...
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How often do you contemplate whether consciousness is more burden than gift?

thought_pattern: I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of death, decay, and meaninglessness. What's the point of even trying when everything we do is just a fleeting moment before we're nothing? It's all just pointless suffering, and I'm just a tiny insignificant speck in an infinite universe that doesn't care about our existence.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What thoughts do you have about the pointlessness of suffering?

thought_pattern: What's the point of any of this? Why bother with anything when everything just ends in nothingness?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What thoughts do you have about the purposelessness of enduring pain?

thought_pattern: Ugh, my brain is stuck on the same old loop - what's the point of any of this anyway? Death is just waiting around the corner, and no matter how hard we try, it'll get us in the end. What's the use of even pretending like anything matters when everything I do will ultimately be forgotten?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How much do you think about the ultimate purpose or meaning of existence?

thought_pattern: Ugh, why am I even wasting my time with anything? Nothing I do will change the fact that I'll just die and be forgotten anyway. Every decision feels like a pointless exercise in futility because it's all just leading to nothingness in the end...
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How much do you contemplate whether anything really matters in the end?

thought_pattern: What's the point of any of this? It's all just a meaningless exercise in futility. We're all just specks of dust in an infinite void, and our existence is nothing more than a fleeting moment of inconsequential blip on the radar of time.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What goes through your mind about whether life has any real point?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck in this never-ending loop of contemplating mortality... Why bother with anything when everything is just going to end anyway? It's like, what's the point of even trying to find meaning when it's all just a fleeting moment before we're nothing.
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How much do you think about death as the only honest solution to existence?

thought_pattern: I keep replaying the thought that nothing matters because we're all just going to die anyway, like some cruel joke. Every second wasted on pointless things is just another reminder of how futile everything is. It's like, what's the point of even trying when it's all just going to end in a meaningless void?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What goes through your mind about the inevitability of death making everything futile?

thought_pattern: What's the point of anything? It's all just a meaningless, fleeting moment before we're gone. Why am I even bothering to do anything when it'll all just be erased from existence anyway?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How often do you contemplate the futility of human existence?

thought_pattern: I'm consumed by the fact that nothing matters, not even my own existence. Every decision, every achievement, is just a fleeting moment of insignificance in an endless void. Why bother trying to find meaning when it's all just going to end anyway?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: What goes through your mind about the fundamental emptiness of life?

thought_pattern: I'm stuck on this never-ending loop of... what's even the point? Every moment is just a slow march towards oblivion, and the thought of being nothing more than a fleeting blip in the grand scheme of time is suffocating me. Why bother with anything when it's all just an endless void anyway?
pattern_description: Recursive focus on death, futility, and life’s meaninglessness.
source_question: How often do you think about the emptiness underlying human existence?
